Package gw.processes

Class BulkInsertWorkQueueBase<E extends KeyableBean,W extends WorkItem>

java.lang.Object
com.guidewire.pl.system.workqueue.WorkQueue<E,W>
gw.processes.WorkQueueBase<E,W>
gw.processes.BulkInsertWorkQueueBase<E,W>
All Implemented Interfaces:
com.guidewire.pl.system.workqueue.DistributedWorker<W>, com.guidewire.pl.system.workqueue.WorkItemCreator<E,W>, com.guidewire.pl.system.workqueue.WorkQueueTargetFinder<E>
Direct Known Subclasses:
PersonalDataBulkInsertWorkQueueBase
public abstract class BulkInsertWorkQueueBase<E extends KeyableBean,W extends WorkItem> extends WorkQueueBase<E,W>
This class in the base class for all customers that want to use bulk insert. A subclass must implement processWorkItem and buildBulkInsertSelect. This query will be executed on the db server. If the WorkItem is StandardWorkItem you can call excludeDuplicatesOnStandardWorkItem in your buildBulkInsertSelect to exclude duplicate work items. This functionality can also be coded for customer work item types.

      Parameters:

      targetType - the type of the target, this should be the same as E

      public BatchProcess createBatchProcess(Object... args)

      Overrides:
      createBatchProcess in class WorkQueueBase<E extends KeyableBean,W extends WorkItem>
      Parameters:
      args - the arguments passed to the batch process Implementation note: actually found a use case for implementing this. These args can be almost anything that can be serialized.

    • createAndExecuteBulkInsert

      protected final int createAndExecuteBulkInsert(IEntityType workItemType, IEntityType targetType, ProcessHistory processHistory, Object... args)
      Create and execute the bulk insert that creates the work items for the targets.
      Parameters:
      workItemType - the entity type of the work item table
      targetType - the entity type of the sync-able target
      processHistory - history for the batch process
      args - the args that were passed for this run. Passed to buildBulkInsertSelect(Object, List)
      Returns:
      the number of created work items

    • buildBulkInsertSelect

      protected abstract void buildBulkInsertSelect(Object opaqueBuilder, List<Object> batchProcessArgs)
      Builds the insert select statement to find the objects that need work done and then create the appropriate work items. Subclasses should:
      • Narrow down the select statement to select just the target items that need work done
      • Use mapColumn to populate any work item columns that need to be set
      The delegate work item columns ProcessHistory and CreationTime are already populated when this method is called; nearly all subclasses should leave them alone.
      Parameters:
      opaqueBuilder - an insert select builder, which selects from a target type and inserts work items of work item type. The builder initially has no restrictions on its select statement so that it will return every instance of the target type.
      batchProcessArgs - the arguments passed to the batch process constructor

    • extractSourceQuery

      protected final IQueryBuilder<E> extractSourceQuery(Object opaqueBuilder)
      getSourceQuery
      Parameters:
      opaqueBuilder - an insert select builder, which selects from a target type and inserts work items of work item type. The builder initially has no restrictions on its select statement so that it will return every instance of the target type.
      Returns:
      Source query

    • excludeDuplicatesOnStandardWorkItem

      protected void excludeDuplicatesOnStandardWorkItem(Object opaqueBuilder, boolean allowFailedDuplicates)
      This helper method will exclude duplicates for standard work items. for other work items this has to be custom code like builder.mapColumn(XXWorkItem#Target.PropertyInfo as IEntityPropertyInfo, XX#Id.PropertyInfo as IEntityPropertyInfo); var subQuery = Queries.createQuery(XXWorkItem); if allowFailedDuplicates subQuery.compare(XXWorkItem#Status.PropertyInfo.Name, NotEquals, WorkItemStatusType.TC_FAILED); builder.SourceQuery.subselect(XX#Id.PropertyInfo.Name, CompareNotIn, subQuery, XXWorkItem#Target.PropertyInfo.Name);
      Parameters:
      opaqueBuilder - the query builder
      allowFailedDuplicates - whether to recreate a failed work item

    • createWorkItem

      public W createWorkItem(E target, Bundle safeBundle)
      This method will create a new work item. This in not needed for BulkInsert.
      Overrides:

      Parameters:
      target - the target object
      safeBundle - the bundle
      Returns:
      a new work item
